creator: pczukor@av.com
text:
For Windows platforms, the classpath in Catalina.bat is replaced instead of 
appended to in this fragment:

set CP=%CATALINA_HOME%\bin\bootstrap.jar;%JAVA_HOME%\lib\tools.jar

This will cause anything else in your classpath to be replaced as far as Tomcat 
is concerned.  In my case, I had the JDBC driver for MySQL in the Classpath and 
the result was that I could not connect to the driver.

Here's one possible fix--replace the line above with this one:

set CP=%CATALINA_HOME%\bin\bootstrap.jar;%JAVA_HOME%\lib\tools.jar;%CLASSPATH%

Thanks to Suresh Lokiah (suresh.lokiah@av.com) for analyzing this bug.

(The catalina.sh script is fine and does not repeat this bug.)

Omitting the user CLASSPATH is deliberate.  CLASSPATHs cause a very large amount 
of grief for users, so Tomcat uses a different philosophy -- you put your JAR 
files in specified directories depending upon the visibility they should have.  
For more info, see

http://jakarta.apache.org/tomcat/tomcat-4.0-doc/class-loader-howto.html

NOTE:  The "catalina.sh" script in the current release (4.0.2b2) is consistent 
with the Windows one in ignoring the user's CLASSPATH.
